content.description: The distribution of sale price for a certain model of car is approximately normal with mean <math alttext="$22,500" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>22</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="$600" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>600</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Based on the distribution, which statement must be true?

choices.label: Approximately <math alttext="99%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>99</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the cars have a sale price less than <math alttext="23,700" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>$</mtext> <mn>23</mn> <mtext>,</mtext> <mn>700</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

Approximately <math alttext="84%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>84</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the cars have a sale price greater than <math alttext="$21,900" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>21</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>900</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Approximately <math alttext="95%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the cars have a sale price between <math alttext="$21,900" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>21</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>900</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="$23,100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>23</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The interquartile range of the sale prices is approximately <math alttext="$600" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>600</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The minimum sale price is <math alttext="$20,700" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>20</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>700</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Approximately <math alttext="84%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>84</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the cars have a sale price greater than <math alttext="$21,900" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>21</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>900</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
